verses.text: Now when Athaliah, the mother of Ahaziah, saw that her son was dead, she arose and destroyed all the royal family.
verses.comment: The phrase 'destroyed all the royal family' reflects the Hebrew idiom for 'put to death.'

verses.text: But Jehosheba, the daughter of King Joram and sister of Ahaziah, took Joash son of Ahaziah and stole him away from among the king’s sons who were being killed, and she put him and his nurse in a bedroom. So they hid him from Athaliah, and he was not killed.
verses.comment: Maintains specifics regarding relationships; 'bedroom' translates 'chamber' as in many modern translations.

verses.text: And he remained with her, hidden in the house of the LORD for six years, while Athaliah reigned over the land.
verses.comment: No significant difference from the Hebrew.

verses.text: But in the seventh year Jehoiada sent and brought the captains of hundreds of the Carites and of the guards, and brought them to him in the house of the LORD. He made a covenant with them and put them under oath in the house of the LORD, and showed them the king’s son.
verses.comment: 'Carites' are a group of mercenaries; 'guards' (Hebrew: 'runners') probably refer to royal bodyguards.

verses.text: And he commanded them, saying, 'This is what you shall do: One-third of you, those who come on duty on the Sabbath, shall guard the king’s house,
verses.comment: 'On duty' renders the Hebrew idiom 'enter on the Sabbath.'

verses.text: one-third shall be at the gate of Sur, and one-third at the gate behind the guards. And you shall guard the palace for defense.
verses.comment: 'Gate of Sur' is preserved from the Hebrew; exact modern location unknown.

verses.text: The two divisions of you who go off duty on the Sabbath shall keep watch over the house of the LORD for the king.
verses.comment: 'Go off duty' is a literal translation of the Hebrew 'go out on the Sabbath;' their role is clarified.

verses.text: You shall surround the king, every man with his weapons in his hand. And whoever comes within the ranks shall be put to death. Be with the king when he goes out and when he comes in.
verses.comment: 'Within the ranks' literally 'within the lines' or 'the precinct.'

verses.text: So the captains of hundreds did everything that Jehoiada the priest commanded, and each took his men—those coming on duty on the Sabbath, and those going off duty—and came to Jehoiada the priest.
verses.comment: Literal rendering of Hebrew; clarifies the rotation of guard shifts.

verses.text: And the priest gave to the captains of hundreds the spears and shields that had belonged to King David, which were in the house of the LORD.
verses.comment: 'Shields' is a direct rendering of the original Hebrew 'round shields.'

verses.text: And the guards stood, every man with his weapons in his hand, from the south side of the house to the north side of the house, around the altar and the house, on behalf of the king.
verses.comment: 'Stood...around the altar and the house' clarifies spatial arrangement.

verses.text: Then he brought out the king’s son, and put the crown on him, and gave him the testimony. And they made him king and anointed him, and they clapped their hands and said, 'Long live the king!'
verses.comment: 'Testimony' refers to the law, as in Deuteronomy 17:18.

verses.text: When Athaliah heard the noise of the guards and the people, she came to the people at the house of the LORD.
verses.comment: Straightforward translation.

verses.text: And she looked, and there was the king standing by the pillar, as was the custom. The captains and the trumpeters were by the king, and all the people of the land rejoiced and blew trumpets. Then Athaliah tore her clothes and cried, 'Treason! Treason!'
verses.comment: 'Standing by the pillar' matches the Hebrew; this was the customary place for the king.

verses.text: Then Jehoiada the priest commanded the captains who were set over the army, saying, 'Bring her out between the ranks, and put to death with the sword anyone who follows her.' For the priest said, 'Let her not be killed in the house of the LORD.'
verses.comment: 'Between the ranks' is a literal rendering of the Hebrew 'between the ranks/lines.'

verses.text: So they laid hands on her, and she went through the horses’ entrance to the king’s house, and there she was put to death.
verses.comment: Hebrew literally: 'She went by way of the horses' entrance.'

verses.text: And Jehoiada made a covenant between the LORD and the king and the people, that they should be the LORD’s people; and also between the king and the people.
verses.comment: 'Covenant' preserves the original theological concept.

verses.text: And all the people of the land went to the house of Baal and broke it down; his altars and his images they broke in pieces thoroughly, and they killed Mattan the priest of Baal before the altars. And the priest posted guards over the house of the LORD.
verses.comment: 'Images' can also be translated 'idols.' Maintains normal convention.

verses.text: Then he took the captains, the Carites, the guards, and all the people of the land, and they brought the king down from the house of the LORD, marching through the gate of the guards to the king’s house. And he took his seat on the royal throne.
verses.comment: 'Took his seat on the royal throne' is literal and clear for modern readers.

verses.text: So all the people of the land rejoiced, and the city was quiet after Athaliah had been put to death with the sword at the king’s house.
verses.comment: Straightforward translation.

verses.text: Joash was seven years old when he became king.
verses.comment: No difference from the Hebrew text.
